title:
Optimal Control for Open Quantum System in Circuit Quantum
  Electrodynamics
authors: Mo Zhou, F. A. C\'ardenas-L\'opez, Sugny Dominique, Xi Chen
abstract:
We propose a quantum optimal control framework based on the Pontryagin
Maximum Principle to design energy- and time-efficient pulses for open quantum
systems. By formulating the Langevin equation of a dissipative LC circuit as a
linear control problem, we derive optimized pulses with exponential scaling in
energy cost, outperforming conventional shortcut-to-adiabaticity methods such
as counter-diabatic driving. When applied to a resonator dispersively coupled
to a qubit, these optimized pulses achieve an excellent signal-to-noise ratio
comparable to longitudinal coupling schemes across varying critical photon
numbers. Our results provide a significant step toward efficient control in
dissipative open systems and improved qubit readout in circuit quantum
electrodynamics.
